snippet: Because foreigners are not allowed to offer testimony in legal disputes in China, foreign-based businesses must rely on their Chinese employees to defend the company’s position.
lead_paragraph: I don’t know any foreign business owner in China who hasn’t been to labor court at least once. Labor courts address and adjudicate cases very quickly, and you will need a Chinese lawyer to represent you. The courts are organized into a three-tiered system in which the first arbitrator makes a decision, and then each party has the right to appeal it to the next-highest tier.
